parameter.name: GatekeeperID
parameter.description: Gatekeeper ID.

parameter.name: TimeToLive
parameter.description: Defines the TimeToLive specification in the registration with the Gatekeeper in {{units}}.

parameter.name: DSCPMark
parameter.description: Diffserv code point to be used for outgoing H.323 signaling packets.

parameter.name: VLANIDMark
parameter.description: VLAN ID (as defined in {{bibref|802.1Q-2005}}) to be used for outgoing H.323 signaling packets for this network. A value of -1 indicates the default value is to be used. If either {{param}} or {{param|EthernetPriorityMark}} is greater than zero, then the outgoing frames MUST be tagged. Otherwise, the outgoing frames MAY be tagged or untagged.

parameter.name: EthernetPriorityMark
parameter.description: Ethernet priority code (as defined in {{bibref|802.1D-2004}}) to be used for outgoing H.323 signaling packets for this network. A value of -1 indicates the default value is to be used. If either {{param|VLANIDMark}} or {{param}} is greater than zero, then the outgoing frames MUST be tagged. Otherwise, the outgoing frames MAY be tagged or untagged.

parameter.name: STUNEnable
parameter.description: Enable or disable use of STUN to allow operation through NAT. Note: enabling STUN is to be interpreted as enabling the use of STUN for discovery, not use as a keep-alive mechanism.

parameter.name: STUNServer
parameter.description: Domain name or IP address of the STUN server.

parameter.name: NonVoiceBandwidthReservedUpstream
parameter.description: For bandwidth-based admission control, a session can proceed only if there is {{param}} {{units}} of upstream bandwidth left available for non-voice traffic. This parameter is appropriate only in implementations in which the actual bandwidth can be known, such as a VoIP device embedded in a DSL B-NT.

parameter.name: NonVoiceBandwidthReservedDownstream
parameter.description: For bandwidth-based admission control, a session can proceed only if there is {{param}} {{units}} of downstream bandwidth left available for non-voice traffic. This parameter is appropriate only in implementations in which the actual bandwidth can be known, such as a VoIP device embedded in a DSL B-NT.

parameter.name: MaxSessions
parameter.description: Limit on the number of simultaneous voice sessions across all {{object|.H323.Client.}} referencing this {{object}}. This MUST be less than or equal to {{param|.Capabilities.MaxSessionCount}}. A value of zero indicates no explicit limit on the number of sessions.

parameter.name: VoIPProfile
parameter.description: VoIP profile to use with this network. {{reference}}

parameter.name: CodecList
parameter.description: {{list}} {{reference}} The CPE SHOULD use the first enabled item in the list among those supported by the remote endpoint and consistent with the available bandwidth.

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.Trunk.{i}.
object.description: Trunk table. The {{object}} holds all parameters a CPE needs to set up a trunk connection with an NGN, as defined in {{bibref|ETSI_TS_181_019}}.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this trunk.

parameter.name: QuiescentMode
parameter.description: If {{true}}, when {{param|Enable}} is set to {{false}} in-progress sessions remain intact, but no new sessions are allowed. When all sessions are terminated, the {{object}} is disabled.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Indicates the status of this trunk.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Origin
parameter.description: Mechanism via which the {{object}} was assigned. {{enum}}

enumeration.description: Automatically generated, for example by a ESBC that auto-creates {{object}} objects.
For example, present in the factory default configuration, created by the ACS, or created by some other management entity (e.g. via a GUI).

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: Name of the trunk.

parameter.name: DDIRange
parameter.description: {{list}} Each range consists of a ''Start'' part consisting of 1 to n digits (string representation) followed by an OPTIONAL ''End'' part consisting of 1 to n digits prefixed by a "-" symbol. Examples: :0123456789 :0123456700-0123456720 Each time this value is changed, the table of Lines managed by the {{object|.Trunk}} is automatically adapted and each value of the {{param}} MUST be represented in corresponding {{param|.CallControl.Line.{i}.DirectoryNumber}} parameter. If this trunk has a {{object|.SIP.Client.}} provider and {{param|.SIP.Client.{i}.E164Format}} is set to {{true}}, full E.164 numbers with country code (but without "+" prefix) MUST be used. This parameter can only be modified if {{param|Origin}} is {{enum|Static|Origin}}.

parameter.name: LineObjectCreation
parameter.description: When {{true}}, a {{object|.CallControl.Line.{i}.}} instance SHOULD be created automatically for each identity within the ranges specified by {{param|DDIRange}}.

parameter.name: MaxChannels
parameter.description: Defines the maximum number of simultaneous communication channels handled by this trunk. A channel is used to convey an information signal, for example a digital bit stream, from one or several senders to one or several receivers.

parameter.name: MaxOutboundChannelCount
parameter.description: Maximal number of simultaneous communication channels in outbound direction supported across this trunk. The maximum number cannot exceed {{param|MaxChannels}} - {{param|MaxInboundChannelCount}}. A value n>0 means, that there are no more than n channels allowed, which are used by outbound calls. A value of -1 means that there are no restrictions in this direction.

parameter.name: MaxInboundChannelCount
parameter.description: Maximal number of simultaneous communication channels in inbound direction supported across this trunk. The maximum number cannot exceed {{param|MaxChannels}} - {{param|MaxOutboundChannelCount}}. A value n>0 means, that there are no more than n channels allowed, which are used by inbound calls. A value of -1 means that there are no restrictions in this direction.

parameter.name: CodecPriority
parameter.description: The {{param}} option controls which end of an inbound call leg will have priority over the negotiation of codecs.

parameter.name: Provider

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.CallControl.
object.description: Call control and call routing parameters. This object is a control plane application for the VoiceService that provides numbers or names based routing, local PBX functionalities and advanced telephony features. It is mutually exclusive with the {{object|.Interwork}} table which is used in case of switching capabilities.

parameter.name: MaxNumberOfLines
parameter.description: Maximum number of {{object|Line.{i}.}} in {{object}}. This value cannot be greater than {{param|.Capabilities.MaxLineCount}}.

parameter.name: MaxNumberOfExtensions
parameter.description: Maximum number of {{object|Extension.{i}.}} in {{object}}. This value cannot be greater than {{param|.Capabilities.MaxExtensionCount}}.

parameter.name: LineNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: ExtensionNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: MailboxNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: IncomingMapNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: OutgoingMapNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: NumberingPlanNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: GroupNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: Enable

parameter.name: QuiescentMode
parameter.description: If {{true}}, when {{param|Enable}} is set to {{false}} in-progress sessions remain intact, but no new sessions are allowed. When all sessions are terminated, the {{object}} is disabled.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Indicates the status of this line.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: CallStatus
parameter.description: Indicates the call status for this line.

parameter.name: Origin
parameter.description: Mechanism via which the {{object}} instance was created.

enumeration.description: explicitly created by the ACS or some other management entity, e.g. via a GUI
created by the CPE according to the {{param|.Trunk.{i}.DDIRange}} setting of the associated {{object|.Trunk.{i}.}} in {{param|Provider}}

parameter.name: DirectoryNumber
parameter.description: Directory number associated with this line.

parameter.name: Provider
parameter.description: Provider for the line. The value MUST be the path name of a row in one of the following tables: {{reference}}

parameter.name: CallingFeatures

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.CallControl.Line.{i}.Stats.
object.description: Statistics for this {{object|#}} instance. The CPE MUST reset the line's Stats parameters (unless otherwise stated in individual object or parameter descriptions) either when the line becomes operationally down due to a previous administrative down (i.e. the line's {{param|#.Status}} parameter transitions to a down state after the line is disabled) or when the line becomes administratively up (i.e. the line's {{param|#.Enable}} parameter transitions from {{false}} to {{true}}).

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.CallControl.Line.{i}.Stats.IncomingCalls.
object.description: Statistics for incoming calls.

parameter.name: CallsReceived
parameter.description: Total number of received calls to the line.

parameter.name: CallsConnected
parameter.description: Total number of calls that successfully completed call setup signaling.

parameter.name: CallsFailed
parameter.description: Total number of calls that failed to successfully complete call setup signaling.

parameter.name: CallsDropped
parameter.description: Total calls that were successfully connected, but dropped unexpectedly while in progress without explicit user termination.

parameter.name: TotalCallTime
parameter.description: Cumulative call duration in {{units}}.

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.CallControl.Line.{i}.Stats.OutgoingCalls.

parameter.name: CallsAttempted

parameter.name: CallsConnected

parameter.name: CallsFailed
parameter.description: Total number of calls that failed to successfully complete call setup signaling.

parameter.name: CallsDropped
parameter.description: Total calls that were successfully connected, but dropped unexpectedly while in progress without explicit user termination.

parameter.name: TotalCallTime
parameter.description: Cumulative call duration in {{units}}.

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.CallControl.Line.{i}.Stats.RTP.

parameter.name: PacketsReceived
parameter.description: Total number of RTP packets received.

parameter.name: PacketsSent

parameter.name: PacketsLost

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.CallControl.Extension.{i}.
object.description: Extension table containing the local numbers and names. Support for adding and removing extensions is conditional on whether the CPE supports more than one line in total as indicated by {{param|.Capabilities.MaxExtensionCount}}.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enable or disable this extension.

parameter.name: QuiescentMode
parameter.description: If {{true}}, when {{param|Enable}} is set to {{false}} in-progress sessions remain intact, but no new sessions are allowed. When all sessions are terminated, the {{object}} is disabled.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Indicates the status of this extension.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: CallStatus
parameter.description: Indicates the call status for this extension.

parameter.name: Origin
parameter.description: Mechanism via which the {{object}} object was assigned. {{enum}}

enumeration.description: Automatically generated, for example by a ESBC that auto-creates {{object}} objects
For example, present in the factory default configuration, created by the ACS, or created by some other management entity (e.g. via a GUI).

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: The name of this extension. This name will also be used for CallerIdName functionality and for displaying on screen of handset, etc...

parameter.name: ExtensionNumber
parameter.description: The number assigned to this extension for internal calls.

parameter.name: Provider
parameter.description: Provider for the extension. The value MUST be the path name of a row in one of the following tables: {{reference}}

parameter.name: NumberingPlan
parameter.description: Numbering plan to be used for outgoing calls. {{reference}}

parameter.name: CallingFeatures
parameter.description: Set of calling features to apply to this extension. {{reference}}

parameter.name: CallWaitingStatus
parameter.description: Status of endpoint managed call waiting, if supported. {{enum}} This parameter SHOULD NOT be present if the CPE does not support endpoint managed call waiting.

parameter.name: ConferenceCallingStatus
parameter.description: Status of endpoint managed conference calling, if supported. {{enum}} This parameter SHOULD NOT be present if the CPE does not support endpoint managed conference calling.

parameter.name: ConferenceCallingSessionCount
parameter.description: Number of active sessions on this extension. : 0 indicates no call is in progress. : 1 indicates a single call is in progress. : Higher values indicate a conference call is in progress. This parameter SHOULD NOT be present if the CPE does not support endpoint managed conference calling.

parameter.name: VoiceMail
parameter.description: Voice mail to use when the {{object}} is not responding. {{reference}}

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.CallControl.Group.{i}.
object.description: This object models an extension as a group of extensions.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Extensions
parameter.description: {{list}} If this parameter is null the group is treated as a group that contains all extensions. {{reference}}

parameter.name: RingType
parameter.description: Defines the way of ringing for the extensions in this group. {{enum}}

enumeration.description: all extensions ring together
extensions ring one by one in the order defined in {{param|Extensions}}. If the ringing extension doesnât answer after {{param|RingTimeout}}, the next extension in the list is tried
as Hierarchical, but the list is not reset between incoming calls

parameter.name: RingTimeout
parameter.description: The time (in {{units}}) to wait for extension reply before trying the next extension. Only applicable if {{param|RingType}} = {{enum|Hierarchical|RingType}} or {{enum|Cyclic|RingType}}.

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.CallControl.Mailbox.{i}.
object.description: Voice mail configuration related to a particular extension.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this entry.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: MaxMsg
parameter.description: This limits the number of messages in a voicemail folder.

parameter.name: MaxMessageTime
parameter.description: Defines the maximum amount of time in {{units}} of an incoming message. Use this when there are many users and disk space is limited. A value of 0 means there will be no maximum time limit enforced.

parameter.name: MinSize
parameter.description: Minimal size in {{units}} of the voicemail box.

parameter.name: SMTPServerAddress
parameter.description: SMTP server FQDN or IP Address used for voicemail notifications.

parameter.name: SMTPServerPort
parameter.description: SMTP server port for voicemail notifications.

parameter.name: SMTPUser
parameter.description: SMTP user name.

parameter.name: SMTPPassword
parameter.description: SMTP password.

parameter.name: SMTPAuthenticationType
parameter.description: Type of authentication used to connect to the SMTP server.

parameter.name: SMTPFrom
parameter.description: Sender's email address.

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.CallControl.IncomingMap.{i}.
object.description: The {{object}} is a table that is used to control which extensions ring when an incoming call is received. The map approach separates the call routing aspects from the configuration of the lines and extensions. It support PBX concepts such as DDI (one extension per line) and groups (parallel dialing if extensions have same priority and hunting when extensions have different priority).

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this entry.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Line
parameter.description: {{object|#.Line}} used by the call. {{reference}}

parameter.name: Extension
parameter.description: {{object|#.Extension}} that rings on incoming call. {{reference}}

parameter.name: Order
parameter.description: Indicates the order in which extensions ring. First all extensions with the lowest order value will ring. When all these extensions have rejected the call or did not reply, the next order value will be attempted.

parameter.name: Timeout
parameter.description: The time in {{units}} the extension will ring before it is considered that there was no reply.

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.CallControl.OutgoingMap.{i}.
object.description: The {{object}} is a table that is used to control which line is used when an extension makes a call.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this entry.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: CLIPNoScreeningNumber
parameter.description: Public number to be presented outgoing calls, instead of the effective extension number.

parameter.name: Extension
parameter.description: {{object|#.Extension}} which makes the outgoing call. {{reference}}

parameter.name: Line
parameter.description: Identifies the {{object|#.Line}} to be used for outgoing calls. When applicable in the signaling protocol the DirectoryNumber will be used as source number for this call. Note: The Line to be used for an outgoing call can be overridden by the {{object|#.NumberingPlan}}. {{reference}}

parameter.name: Order
parameter.description: The order in which using the lines is attempted. This is used to implement a backup mechanism. If the first line is not available, using the next one will be attempted.

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.CallControl.NumberingPlan.{i}.
object.description: Information related the numbering plan. {{object}} is applicable only if the device supports a dialing mechanism for which a number plan is needed (for example, some devices with an explicit Dial button do not need to be aware of the dialing plan) and if the device does not already support a numbering plan mechanism for this call control (e.g., in-band via MGCP).

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: MinimumNumberOfDigits
parameter.description: This is the minimum number of digits to be collected before an outgoing request (e.g., a SIP INVITE) can be initiated. If ''End of Dialing'' (as defined in {{param|InterDigitTimerStd}}) occurs before the minimum number of digits has been reached then the number will be considered incomplete and no request will be initiated. In practice, searching {{object|.CallControl.NumberingPlan.{i}.PrefixInfo.{i}.}} commences only once {{param}} digits has been received.

parameter.name: MaximumNumberOfDigits
parameter.description: When this number of digits has been collected, an outgoing request (e.g., a SIP INVITE) MUST be initiated. Any additional dialed digits will be ignored. This parameter is only used in the case that no match in {{object|.CallControl.NumberingPlan.{i}.PrefixInfo.{i}.}} has been found.

parameter.name: InterDigitTimerStd
parameter.description: This timer is the maximum allowable time (expressed in {{units}}) between the dialing of digits. This timer is restarted every time a digit is dialed. Expiration of this timer indicates ''End of Dialing''.

parameter.name: InterDigitTimerOpen
parameter.description: This timer is the maximum allowable time (expressed in {{units}}) between the dialing of digits once the minimum number of digits defined on a prefix based has been reached. This timer is only applicable to "open numbering", where the exact number of digits for a prefix is not known.

parameter.name: TerminationDigit
parameter.description: Digit that can be used by the subscriber to indicate that dialing has completed.

parameter.name: InvalidNumberTone
parameter.description: The tone that tells the user when the number dialed is determined to be invalid. {{reference}}

parameter.name: PrefixInfoMaxEntries
parameter.description: This is the maximum number of instances of {{object|.CallControl.NumberingPlan.{i}.PrefixInfo.{i}.}} that can be supported.

parameter.name: PrefixInfoNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Indicates the number of instances of {{object|.CallControl.NumberingPlan.{i}.PrefixInfo.{i}.}}.

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.CallControl.NumberingPlan.{i}.PrefixInfo.{i}.
object.description: Each entry in this table contains information related to an individual prefix in the NumberingPlan. It is anticipated that once the minimum number of digits has been received, the VoIP device will search this prefix list every time a new digit is received. If no new entry is found, then the object that was previously found will be used instead. If supported, {{param|.CallControl.NumberingPlan.{i}.PrefixInfoMaxEntries}} and {{param|.CallControl.NumberingPlan.{i}.PrefixInfoNumberOfEntries}} MUST be present. The defaults given for this object apply only to explicit creation of an instance of this object and not to automatic creation of instances of this object due to creation of a parent object.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this entry.

parameter.name: PrefixRange
parameter.description: This is a string representation of a range of prefixes. Each prefix consists of a ''From'' part consisting of 1 to n digits (string representation) followed by an OPTIONAL ''To'' part consisting of exactly one digit prefixed by a "-" symbol. All characters in the "From" and "To" parts of the prefix range MUST be "0-9", "*" or "#". A further constraint is that the "To" digit MUST always be numerically greater than the last digit of the "From" part. Examples: : 02 : 031-5 : 032 : 0325 : *#34 : #22

parameter.name: PrefixMinNumberOfDigits
parameter.description: This is the minimum number of allowable digits for the prefix range. Once the minimum number of digits has been reached, {{param|#.InterDigitTimerOpen}} will be used instead of {{param|#.InterDigitTimerStd}}. If the minimum number of digits has been reached and the inter-digit timer expires, an outgoing request is initiated.

parameter.name: PrefixMaxNumberOfDigits
parameter.description: This is the maximum number of allowable digits for the prefix range. Once the number of digits received reaches this value an outgoing request is initiated.

parameter.name: NumberOfDigitsToRemove
parameter.description: If this parameter has a non-zero value, the specified number of digits will be removed from the internal digit buffer (which contains the dialed digits) from the position specified by {{param|PosOfDigitsToRemove}}. Subsequently a search of {{object}} for a matching prefix using the modified number is performed. Note that this parameter does not have any impact on the number sent in the outgoing request: it is used only for searching within the Numbering Plan. This parameter has no effect if it is set to 0. This parameter is provided to handle Carrier override and other codes used as prefix to standard numbers and to ensure that the correct ''End of Dialing'' can be specified without significant data duplication.

parameter.name: PosOfDigitsToRemove
parameter.description: This parameter is used in conjunction with {{param|NumberOfDigitsToRemove}}. It specifies the position within the internal digit buffer from which the digits are to be removed.

parameter.name: DialTone
parameter.description: The tone to be played by the VoIP device when the user has dialed exactly the same digits as defined in the prefix. The VoIP device will cease playing the tone once an additional digit has been dialed. {{reference}}

parameter.name: FacilityAction
parameter.description: This is a string representing a Facility Action implemented by the VoIP device. The parameter MAY instead indicate a vendor-specific Facility Action, which MUST use the format defined in {{bibref|TR-106}}. When {{empty}} or the value is an unrecognized string (i.e. a Facility Action not supported by the CPE) normal outgoing requests are made.

parameter.name: FacilityActionArgument
parameter.description: Optional argument associated with {{param|FacilityAction}}. The interpretation of the argument is dependent on a specific value of {{param|FacilityAction}}. {{reference}}

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.CallControl.CallingFeatures.
object.description: This object models the calling features that can be apply on {{object|.CallControl.Line}} or {{object|.CallControl.Extension}}.

parameter.name: SetNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.CallControl.CallingFeatures.Set.{i}.
object.description: This object models a set of calling features that can be applied in {{object|.CallControl.Line.}} or {{object|.CallControl.Extension.}} objects.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: CallerIDEnable
parameter.description: Enable or disable the transmission of caller ID information on incoming calls (CLIP).

parameter.name: CallerIDNameEnable
parameter.description: Enable or disable the transmission of caller ID name information on incoming calls (CNIP).

parameter.name: CallWaitingEnable
parameter.description: Enables or disables call waiting in the Endpoint. This parameter SHOULD NOT be present if the CPE does not support Endpoint managed call waiting.

parameter.name: CallForwardUnconditionalEnable
parameter.description: Enables or disables unconditional call forwarding by the endpoint. This parameter SHOULD NOT be present if the CPE does not support Endpoint based call forwarding.

parameter.name: CallForwardUnconditionalNumber
parameter.description: Directory number to which all incoming calls to this line are forwarded when {{param|CallForwardUnconditionalEnable}} is {{true}}. This parameter SHOULD NOT be present if the CPE does not support Endpoint based call forwarding

parameter.name: CallForwardOnBusyEnable
parameter.description: Enables or disables call forwarding-on-busy by the Endpoint. This parameter SHOULD NOT be present if the CPE does not support Endpoint based call forwarding.

parameter.name: CallForwardOnBusyNumber
parameter.description: Directory number to which all incoming calls to this line are forwarded when {{param|CallForwardOnBusyEnable}} is {{true}} and the line is busy. This parameter SHOULD NOT be present if the CPE does not support Endpoint based call forwarding.

parameter.name: CallForwardOnBusyRingTimeout
parameter.description: Delay in {{units}} before considering there is no answer for call forwarding-on-busy. This parameter SHOULD NOT be present if the CPE does not support Endpoint based call forwarding.

parameter.name: CallForwardOnNoAnswerEnable
parameter.description: Enables or disables call forwarding-on-no-answer by the Endpoint. This parameter SHOULD NOT be present if the CPE does not support Endpoint based call forwarding.

parameter.name: CallForwardOnNoAnswerNumber
parameter.description: Directory number to which all incoming calls to this line are forwarded when {{param|CallForwardOnNoAnswerEnable}} is {{true}} and there is no local answer. This parameter SHOULD NOT be present if the CPE does not support Endpoint based call forwarding.

parameter.name: CallForwardOnNoAnswerRingTimeout
parameter.description: Delay in {{units}} before considering there is no answer for call forwarding-on-no-answer. This parameter SHOULD NOT be present if the CPE does not support Endpoint based call forwarding.

parameter.name: CallTransferEnable
parameter.description: Enables or disables call transfer by the Endpoint. This parameter SHOULD NOT be present if the CPE does not support Endpoint based call transfer.

parameter.name: MWIEnable
parameter.description: Enables or disables Message Waiting Indication by the Endpoint. This parameter SHOULD NOT be present if the CPE does not support MWI.

parameter.name: VMWIEnable
parameter.description: Enables or disables Visual Message Waiting Indication.

parameter.name: LineMessagesWaiting
parameter.description: Indicates the number of messages which are currently waiting on this line as known by the CPE. This parameter SHOULD NOT be present if the CPE does not support MWI.

parameter.name: AnonymousCallRejectionEnable
parameter.description: Enable or disable Anonymous Call Block capability in the endpoint (ACR). This parameter SHOULD NOT be present if the CPE does not support endpoint based Anonymous Call Block capability.

parameter.name: AnonymousCallEnable
parameter.description: Enable or disable Anonymous Call capability in the endpoint (CLIR). This parameter SHOULD NOT be present if the CPE does not support endpoint based Anonymous Call capability.

parameter.name: DoNotDisturbEnable
parameter.description: Enable or disable Do Not Disturb capability in the Endpoint. When enabled, all calls are forwarded to voice mail. This parameter SHOULD NOT be present if the CPE does not support Endpoint based Do Not Disturb capability.

parameter.name: RepeatDialEnable
parameter.description: Enable or disable Repeat Dial capability in the Endpoint. This parameter SHOULD NOT be present if the CPE does not support Endpoint based Repeat Dial capability.

parameter.name: VoiceMailEnable
parameter.description: Enable or disable Voice Mail capability in the Endpoint. This parameter SHOULD NOT be present if the CPE does not support Endpoint based Voice Mail capability.

parameter.name: CallPickUpEnable
parameter.description: Enable or disable Call Interception capability in the Endpoint.

parameter.name: CCBSEnable
parameter.description: Enable or disable automatic recall on busy (Completion of Calls to Busy Subscriber) capability in the Endpoint.

parameter.name: IIFCEnable
parameter.description: Enable or disable successive forwarding (Inhibition of Incoming Forwarded Calls) from the Endpoint.

parameter.name: BlockForwardEnable
parameter.description: Allow or block any internal forward to the Endpoint.

parameter.name: SecretForwarderEnable
parameter.description: Enable or disable secret identity of this Endpoint in case it initiates (on an external incoming call) a forward to another internal phone Endpoint. If enabled, only the remote ''caller party'' can be identified (if not anonymous), not this intermediate ''via'' phone extension.

parameter.name: FollowMeEnable
parameter.description: Enable or disable FollowMe capability in the Endpoint.

parameter.name: CFTNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: SCFNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: SCREJNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: FollowMeNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.CallControl.CallingFeatures.Set.{i}.CFT.{i}.
object.description: This object defines a Call Forwarding Timed (CFT) that permit the user to forward calls to particular destinations depending on the time of day. Note: a bad configuration (e.g. timeslots overlapping) could cause unexpected behavior.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Whether this schedule is currently enabled.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Day
parameter.description: Day where the schedule active.

enumeration.description: For all days schedule

parameter.name: StartTime
parameter.description: Start time of the schedule in the form : hh:mm.

parameter.name: EndTime
parameter.description: End time of the schedule in the form : hh:mm.

parameter.name: ForwardedToNumber
parameter.description: Number to forward the call to.

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.CallControl.CallingFeatures.Set.{i}.SCF.{i}.
object.description: This object defines a Selective Call Forwarding (SCF) that permit the user to forward calls to different destinations depending on the calling number.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this Selective Call Forward.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: CallingNumber
parameter.description: Calling number concerned by the forward. The CPE SHOULD perform an exact match with this string without any attempts at number normalization.

parameter.name: ForwardedToNumber
parameter.description: Number to forward the call to.

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.CallControl.CallingFeatures.Set.{i}.SCREJ.{i}.
object.description: This object defines a Selective Call Rejection (SCREJ) that permit the user to selectively reject calls depending on the calling number.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this Selective Call Rejection.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: CallingNumber
parameter.description: Calling number concerned by the reject. The CPE SHOULD perform an exact match with this string without any attempts at number normalization.

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.CallControl.CallingFeatures.Set.{i}.FollowMe.{i}.
object.description: This object defines the FollowMe destinations mapping definition, in the provided sequence order.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this FollowMe sequence item.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Delay
parameter.description: Delay in {{units}} before next FollowMe sequence item applies.

parameter.name: Number
parameter.description: Directory number to which all incoming calls to this line are forwarded to after {{param|Delay}}, when {{param|#.FollowMeEnable}} is {{true}}. In this case, {{param|#.CallForwardOnNoAnswerNumber}} is not used.

parameter.name: Order
parameter.description: For a given {{param|Number}}, defines the order of this item in the FollowMe sequence.

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.CallControl.CallingFeatures.Set.{i}.Voice2Mail.
object.description: Voice to mail specific attributes. Applies only if {{param|#.VoiceMailEnable}} is set to {{true}}.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enable or disable voice mail notification.

parameter.name: MaxMessageLength
parameter.description: Defines the maximum amount of time in {{units}} of an incoming message. Use this when there are many users and disk space is limited. A value of 0 means there will be no maximum time limit enforced.

parameter.name: Attach
parameter.description: Indicates if the message is sent as an attachment in voice mail notification.

parameter.name: KeepLocal
parameter.description: Whether the voice to mail message is kept on the CPE after sending the mail. Applicable only if {{param|Attach}} is {{true}}.

parameter.name: EMailAddress
parameter.description: E-mail for voice to mail notification messages.

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.Interwork.{i}.
object.description: Each entry in this table configures Inter-Working Function switching features. It is mutually exclusive with the {{object|.CallControl}} object which is used in case of PBX or Endpoint capabilities.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enable or disable this {{object}} instance.

parameter.name: QuiescentMode
parameter.description: If {{true}}, when {{param|Enable}} is set to {{false}} in-progress sessions remain intact, but no new sessions are allowed. When all sessions are terminated, the {{object}} is disabled.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Indicates the status of this {{object}} instance.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: OperationalStatus
parameter.description: Indicates the operational status of the {{object}} connections when {{param|Status}} is {{enum|Up|Status}}. {{enum}}

enumeration.description: Indicates the {{object}} is operational.
Indicates the {{object}} is not operational.
Indicates the {{object}} has lost connection to all of the Network servers.

parameter.name: OperationalStatusReason
parameter.description: Human-readable string identifying the reason or explanation for the current {{param|OperationalStatus}}.

parameter.name: NetworkConnectionMode
parameter.description: This parameter indicates whether or not the CPE supports a registration procedure that conveys its signaling IP address:port to the network. This parameter also indicates whether the network-facing Client object and its parameters are statically provisioned by the ACS or dynamically created by the CPE. {{enum}}

enumeration.description: The CPE does not register toward the service provider network. The ACS creates the Client object and statically provisions the Client parameters, including the signaling address

The CPE registers toward the service provider network. The ACS creates the Client object and statically provisions its parameters, excluding the signaling address which is dynamically assigned by the CPE
The CPE registers toward the service provider network. The CPE creates the Client object and dynamically assigns its signaling address
The CPE registers toward the service provider network. The ACS creates the Client object and statically provisions the Client parameters, including the signaling address

parameter.name: UserConnectionMode
parameter.description: This parameter indicates whether or not an externally connected user device supports a registration procedure to convey its signaling address to the CPE. This parameter also indicates whether the user-facing objects and parameters that contain the external user device signaling address are statically provisioned by the ACS or dynamically learned by the CPE. {{enum}}

enumeration.description: The external user device does not register with the CPE. The ACS creates the object containing the signaling address of the externally connected user device and statically configures the signaling address of the user device

The externally connected user device registers with the CPE. The ACS creates the object that contains the signaling address of the external user device. The CPE sets the signaling address learned when the user device registers

The externally connected user device registers with the CPE. The CPE dynamically creates the object that contains the signaling address of the external user device and sets the signaling address learned when the user device registers

parameter.name: E164Mode
parameter.description: This attribute indicates whether or not the CPE performs E.164 routing of incoming requests received from the service provider network when the target Endpoint is a PBX.

parameter.name: NetworkAuthenticationChallengeMode
parameter.description: This parameter indicates how the CPE treats authentication challenges received from the service provider network. This parameter only has meaning when the CPE supports an externally connected user device (e.g., the CPE is acting as a gateway between the user device and the network). {{enum}}

enumeration.description: The CPE transparently passes authentication challenges and challenge responses between the service provider network and the external user device

The CPE responds to authentication challenges received from the service provider network on behalf of the externally connected user device. The CPE does not send authentication challenges to the externally connected user device

The CPE responds to authentication challenges received from the service provider network on behalf of the externally connected user device. In addition, the CPE generates authentication challenges toward the externally connected user device

parameter.name: NetworkIPAddress
parameter.description: The network IP Address of the CPE. The CPE MUST resolve this when the {{object|.Interwork.{i}.}} object is created. Note: In case of multiple network IP addresses, the choice is left to the CPE.

parameter.name: InterworkingRuleSetURI
parameter.description: URI of the Interworking Rule Set for this {{object}} instance.

parameter.name: InterworkingRuleSetInterval
parameter.description: The duration in {{units}} of the interval for which the CPE SHOULD send request to refresh the Interworking Rule Set. A value of '0' indicates that this feature is disabled.

parameter.name: InterworkingRuleSetTime
parameter.description: An absolute time reference in UTC to determine when the CPE will send a request to refresh the Interworking Rule Set. Each refresh request MUST occur at this reference time plus or minus an integer multiple of the {{param|InterworkingRuleSetInterval}}. {{param}} is used only to set the ''phase'' of refresh requests. The actual value of {{param}} can be arbitrarily far into the past or future. For example, if {{param|InterworkingRuleSetInterval}} is 86400 (a day) and if {{param}} is set to UTC midnight on some day (in the past, present, or future) then the refresh requests will occur every day at UTC midnight. These MUST begin on the very next midnight, even if {{param}} refers to a day in the future. The Unknown Time value defined in {{bibref|TR-106a2|section 3.2}} indicates that no particular time reference is specified. That is, the CPE MAY locally choose the time reference, and needs only to adhere to the specified {{param|InterworkingRuleSetInterval}}. If absolute time is not available to the CPE, its behavior MUST be the same as if the {{param}} parameter was set to the Unknown Time value.

parameter.name: FirewallRuleSetURI
parameter.description: URI of the Firewall Rule Set for this {{object}} instance.

parameter.name: FirewallRuleSetInterval
parameter.description: The duration in {{units}} of the interval for which the CPE SHOULD send request to refresh the Firewall Rule Set. A value of '0' indicates that this feature is disabled.

parameter.name: FirewallRuleSetTime
parameter.description: An absolute time reference in UTC to determine when the CPE will send a request to refresh the Firewall Rule Set. Each refresh request MUST occur at this reference time plus or minus an integer multiple of the {{param|FirewallRuleSetInterval}}. {{param}} is used only to set the ''phase'' of refresh requests. The actual value of {{param}} can be arbitrarily far into the past or future. For example, if {{param|FirewallRuleSetInterval}} is 86400 (a day) and if {{param}} is set to UTC midnight on some day (in the past, present, or future) then the refresh requests will occur every day at UTC midnight. These MUST begin on the very next midnight, even if {{param}} refers to a day in the future. The Unknown Time value defined in {{bibref|TR-106a2|section 3.2}} indicates that no particular time reference is specified. That is, the CPE MAY locally choose the time reference, and needs only to adhere to the specified {{param|FirewallRuleSetInterval}}. If absolute time is not available to the CPE, its behavior MUST be the same as if the {{param}} parameter was set to the Unknown Time value.

parameter.name: InterworkName
parameter.description: Human-readable string identifying the name or explanation for this {{object}}.

parameter.name: ProxyServer
parameter.description: Reference to the {{object|.SIP.Proxy}} associated with this {{object}}. {{reference}}

parameter.name: Networks
parameter.description: {{list}} {{reference}} List of available Networks for routing calls.

parameter.name: E164Client
parameter.description: This parameter is MUST contain the {{object|.SIP.Client}} for all {{object|.Trunk}} objects referenced in the {{object|Map}} table when {{param|E164Mode}} = {{true}}.

parameter.name: UserInterfaceNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: MapNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.Interwork.{i}.UserInterface.{i}.
object.description: Each table entry references a row in the {{object|.SIP.Registrar}} table to identify the User IP address and listening port for the Device and the Network to route calls to.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enable ({{true}}) or disable ({{false}}) {{object}}.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Registrar
parameter.description: The {{object|.SIP.Registrar}} to use with this {{object|#}}. The value of {{param}} MUST be unique over all {{object|.Interwork.{i}.}}. {{reference}}

parameter.name: Network
parameter.description: If not null this provides the appropriate {{object|.SIP.Network}} to route calls from this User server to. {{reference}}

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.Interwork.{i}.Map.{i}.
object.description: For interworking use cases such as SIP-ISDN PBX plug and ESBC : mapping instance between a Network interface and a User extension.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enable ({{true}}) or disable ({{false}}) this connection mapping.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Indicates the status of this connection mapping. {{enum}}

enumeration.description: indicates the {{object}} is valid
indicates the {{object}} is valid but either the Network or User connection is not operational

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: StatusDescription
parameter.description: Human-readable string identifying the reason or explanation of the current mapping {{param|Status}}.

parameter.name: LastTime
parameter.description: The last time the Status was updated.

parameter.name: Origin
parameter.description: Mechanism via which this connection mapping was assigned. {{enum}}

enumeration.description: Automatically generated, for example by a ESBC that auto-creates User and Network connections
For example, present in the factory default configuration, created by the ACS, or created by some other management entity (e.g. via a GUI).

parameter.name: NetworkConnection
parameter.description: {{reference}}. This parameter can only be modified if {{param|Origin}} is {{enum|Static|Origin}}.

parameter.name: UserConnection
parameter.description: {{reference}}. This parameter can only be modified if {{param|Origin}} is {{enum|Static|Origin}}.

parameter.name: DigitMap
parameter.description: Digit map controlling digit collection on a User interface. The string defines the criteria to be met as digits are collected before an outgoing request (e.g., a SIP INVITE) can be initiated. The syntax of this parameter is exactly the syntax used by MGCP as defined in {{bibref|RFC3435|Section 2.1.5}}. This parameter is applicable only if the User interface supports per digit dialing and the Network interface supports en-bloc dialing only.

parameter.name: DigitMapEnable
parameter.description: Enables use of {{param|DigitMap}}.

parameter.name: Priority
parameter.description: Indicates the priority for this combination of Network-to-User mapping, where 1 is the highest priority. Where the priority differs between entries in this table, the CPE SHOULD use the highest priority (lowest numbered) entry. Where the priorities are equal among multiple entries, the CPE MAY apply a local criterion for choosing among them.

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.CallLog.{i}.
object.description: This table contains a list of calls. An entry is similar to a CDR (Call Detail Record) as used in PBX or on mobile phones. An entry is created each time a call is terminated. If the number of {{object|.CallLog}} exceeds {{param|.Capabilities.MaxCallLogCount}}, the CPE SHOULD remove the oldest {{object|.CallLog}} object on basis of {{param|Start}} parameter.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: CallingPartyNumber
parameter.description: Number of the party originating the call.

parameter.name: CalledPartyNumber
parameter.description: Number of destination party of the call.

parameter.name: Source
Destination
RemoteParty
parameter.description: The phone number of the remote party after the dial plan has been processed.

parameter.name: UsedLine
UsedExtensions
Direction
parameter.description: Direction of the call.

parameter.name: Start
parameter.description: Start of the call.

parameter.name: Duration
parameter.description: Length of the call in {{units}}.

parameter.name: CallTerminationCause
parameter.description: The call termination cause. The parameter MAY instead indicate a vendor-specific cause, which MUST use the format defined in {{bibref|TR-106}}.

parameter.name: SessionNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Indicates the number of entries in {{object|.CallLog.{i}.Session.{i}.}}. Sessions are the equivalent of RTP streams in VoIP calls : a call can have more than one session in sequence when codec changes happen during a call. In multimedia calls, multiple sessions in parallel are possible.

parameter.name: SignalingPerformanceNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.CallLog.{i}.SignalingPerformance.{i}.
object.description: This table contains signaling performance statistics for each protocol involved in the call.

parameter.name: Protocol
parameter.description: Protocol for which this signaling performance statistics are available.

parameter.name: CallSetupDelay
parameter.description: The time between the instant a system receives a call attempt and the instant of invitation of ringing at the call receiver end instrument in {{units}}.

parameter.name: OutgoingMediaEstablishDelay
parameter.description: The time in {{units}} between : :- the instant a system has received information that the called party is connected :- the instant the first media packet goes out the CPE The value could be negative if a media packet is sent before the connection establishment.

parameter.name: IncomingMediaEstablishDelay
parameter.description: The time in {{units}} between : :- the instant a system has received information that the called party is connected :- the instant the first media packet goes into the CPE The value could be negative if a media packet arrives before the connection establishment.

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.CallLog.{i}.Session.{i}.
object.description: Session information within one call.

parameter.name: StreamType
parameter.description: The type of media stream used in this session.

parameter.name: Start
parameter.description: The time that the session started, in UTC.

parameter.name: Duration
parameter.description: Length of the session in {{units}}.

parameter.name: SessionID
parameter.description: Session identifier.

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.CallLog.{i}.Session.{i}.Source.
object.description: The source of the session information within one call.

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.CallLog.{i}.Session.{i}.Source.RTP.
object.description: The RTP part of the source session information.

parameter.name: FarEndIPAddress
parameter.description: The IP address of far end VoIP device.

parameter.name: FarEndUDPPort
parameter.description: The UDP port used for current session in the far end device.

parameter.name: LocalUDPPort
parameter.description: The local UDP port used for current session.

parameter.name: MinJitter
parameter.description: The minimum relative transit time in {{units}} between two packets as defined in {{bibref|RFC3611}}. A value of -1 indicates no reliable value is available.

parameter.name: MaxJitter
parameter.description: The maximum relative transit time in {{units}} between two packets as defined in {{bibref|RFC3611}}. A value of -1 indicates no reliable value is available.

parameter.name: MeanJitter
parameter.description: The mean relative transit time in {{units}} between each two packet series as defined in {{bibref|RFC3611}}. A value of -1 indicates no reliable value is available.

parameter.name: PacketDelayVariation
parameter.description: 1-Point Packet Delay Variation according to {{bibref|Y.1540}} in {{units}}. A value of -1 indicates no reliable value is available.

parameter.name: BufferDelay
parameter.description: Average delay in {{units}} added by buffer processing. A value of -1 indicates no reliable value is available.

parameter.name: BurstCount
parameter.description: The number of bursts (as defined in {{bibref|RFC3611}}) that occur during this session (during one burst several packets MAY be lost). The burst's threshold is configured with the parameter {{param|.VoIPProfile.{i}.RTP.Gmin}}.

parameter.name: PacketsReceived
parameter.description: Total number of RTP packets received for this session.

parameter.name: PacketsSent
parameter.description: Total number of RTP packets sent for this session.

parameter.name: PacketsLost
parameter.description: Total number of RTP packets that have been lost for this session (see {{bibref|RFC3611}}).

parameter.name: PacketsDiscarded
parameter.description: Total number of RTP packets that have been discarded for this session (see {{bibref|RFC3611}}).

parameter.name: BytesReceived
parameter.description: Total number of bytes received for this session.

parameter.name: BytesSent
parameter.description: Total number of bytes sent for this session.

parameter.name: ReceivePacketLossRate
parameter.description: Current receive packet loss rate in percent, calculated as defined in {{bibref|RFC3550|Section 6.4}}.

parameter.name: FarEndPacketLossRate
parameter.description: Current far end receive packet lost rate in percent, calculated as defined in {{bibref|RFC3550|Section 6.4}}.

parameter.name: ReceiveInterarrivalJitter
parameter.description: Current receive interarrival jitter in timestamp units. Calculated from J(i) as defined in {{bibref|RFC3550|Section 6.4}}. A value of -1 indicates no reliable value is available.

parameter.name: FarEndInterarrivalJitter
parameter.description: Current Interarrival jitter in timestamp units as reported from the far-end device via RTCP. Calculated from J(i) as defined in {{bibref|RFC3550|Section 6.4}}. A value of -1 indicates no reliable value is available.

parameter.name: AverageReceiveInterarrivalJitter
parameter.description: Average receive interarrival jitter in timestamp units since the beginning of the current call. Calculated as the average of the interarrival jitter values reported by the far-end. A value of -1 indicates no reliable value is available.

parameter.name: AverageFarEndInterarrivalJitter
parameter.description: Average far-end interarrival jitter in timestamp units since the beginning of the current call. Calculated as the average of the interarrival jitter values reported by the far-end. A value of -1 indicates no reliable value is available.

parameter.name: RoundTripDelay
parameter.description: Current round trip delay in {{units}} calculated as defined in {{bibref|RFC3550|Section 6.4}}. A value of -1 indicates no reliable value is available.

parameter.name: AverageRoundTripDelay
parameter.description: Average round trip delay in {{units}} since the beginning of the current session. A value of -1 indicates no reliable value is available.

parameter.name: SamplingFrequency
parameter.description: Sample frequency in {{units}} used by the codec for this session.

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.CallLog.{i}.Session.{i}.Source.DSP.
object.description: The DSP part of the line session information.

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.CallLog.{i}.Session.{i}.Source.DSP.ReceiveCodec.
object.description: The receive codec used in this session.

parameter.name: Codec
parameter.description: The codec in use for the incoming voice stream. {{reference}}

parameter.name: SilenceSuppression
parameter.description: Whether or not silence suppression is in use for the incoming voice stream.

parameter.name: Overruns
parameter.description: Total number of times the receive jitter buffer has overrun for this session.

parameter.name: Underruns
parameter.description: Total number of times the receive jitter buffer has underrun for this session.

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.CallLog.{i}.Session.{i}.Source.DSP.TransmitCodec.
object.description: The transmit codec used in this session.

parameter.name: Codec
parameter.description: The codec in use for the outgoing voice stream. {{reference}}

parameter.name: SilenceSuppression
parameter.description: Whether or not silence suppression is in use for the outgoing voice stream.

parameter.name: PacketizationPeriod
parameter.description: Current outgoing packetization period in {{units}}.

parameter.name: Overruns
parameter.description: Total number of times the transmit jitter buffer has overrun for this session.

parameter.name: Underruns
parameter.description: Total number of times the transmit jitter buffer has underrun for this session.

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.CallLog.{i}.Session.{i}.Source.VoiceQuality.
object.description: VoIP Statistics for current session instance.

parameter.name: VoIPQualityIndicator
parameter.description: {{list|representing the VoIP quality calculated for consecutive intervals of the session}} The interval is specified by {{param|.VoIPProfile.{i}.QICalculationInterval}} and the quality model used is specified by {{param|.VoIPProfile.{i}.QIModelUsed}}. The statistics values in this list MUST be in time order, with the oldest one first and the most recent one last. For long sessions the number of values might exceed the limit given by {{param|.Capabilities.QualityIndicator.MaxQIValues}}. In that case, the CPE MUST remove the oldest values to keep the number of reported values within the limit. The interpretation of the QI values are algorithm-specific, the only constraints being the range and the fact that lower values indicate worse quality than do higher values. For instance, if {{param}} is reported as "78,57,88,79,34,56", and {{param|.VoIPProfile.{i}.QICalculationInterval}} is 10 seconds, the quality during the first ten seconds was 78, the next ten seconds 57, and so on. The last reported value (here 56) might cover a shorter time period than {{param|.VoIPProfile.{i}.QICalculationInterval}}, but the length can be deduced using {{param|##.Duration}}.

parameter.name: WorstVoIPQualityIndicatorsValues
parameter.description: {{list|representing the worst VoIP quality indicators calculated during the whole session}} Only the N worst values are stored, where N is the limit stored in the {{param|.VoIPProfile.{i}.NumberOfWorstQIValues}} attribute. The values are given in the same algorithm-specific representation as {{param|VoIPQualityIndicator}}, and MUST be in quality-order with the lowest value first. Example: "34,56,57" are the 3 worst values calculated during the call.

parameter.name: WorstVoIPQualityIndicatorTimestamps
parameter.description: {{list}} Each value represents the timestamp index, given in units of {{param|.VoIPProfile.{i}.QICalculationInterval}}, when the corresponding value in {{param|WorstVoIPQualityIndicatorsValues}} was calculated. The first index is number 1. Only the N worst values are stored, where N is the limit stored in {{param|.VoIPProfile.{i}.NumberOfWorstQIValues}}. Example: if {{param|.VoIPProfile.{i}.QICalculationInterval}} is equal to 10 (seconds), the value "6,2,5" designates the time intervals 50-60 s, 10-20 s, and 40-50 s when the 3 worst values were calculated.

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.CallLog.{i}.Session.{i}.Destination.
object.description: The destination part of session information within one call.

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.CallLog.{i}.Session.{i}.Destination.RTP.
object.description: The RTP part of the destination session information.

parameter.name: FarEndIPAddress
parameter.description: The IP address of far end VoIP device.

parameter.name: FarEndUDPPort
parameter.description: The UDP port used for current session in the far end device.

parameter.name: LocalUDPPort
parameter.description: The local UDP port used for current session.

parameter.name: MinJitter
parameter.description: The minimum relative transit time in {{units}} between two packets as defined in {{bibref|RFC3611}}. A value of -1 indicates no reliable value is available.

parameter.name: MaxJitter
parameter.description: The maximum relative transit time in {{units}} between two packets as defined in {{bibref|RFC3611}}. A value of -1 indicates no reliable value is available.

parameter.name: MeanJitter
parameter.description: The mean relative transit time in {{units}} between each two packet series as defined in {{bibref|RFC3611}}. A value of -1 indicates no reliable value is available.

parameter.name: PacketDelayVariation
parameter.description: 1-Point Packet Delay Variation according to {{bibref|Y.1540}} in {{units}}. A value of -1 indicates no reliable value is available.

parameter.name: BufferDelay
parameter.description: Average delay in {{units}} added by buffer processing. A value of -1 indicates no reliable value is available.

parameter.name: BurstCount
parameter.description: The number of bursts (as defined in {{bibref|RFC3611}}) that occur during this session (during one burst several packets MAY be lost). The burst's threshold is configured with the parameter {{param|.VoIPProfile.{i}.RTP.Gmin}}.

parameter.name: PacketsReceived
parameter.description: Total number of RTP packets received for this session.

parameter.name: PacketsSent
parameter.description: Total number of RTP packets sent for this session.

parameter.name: PacketsLost
parameter.description: Total number of RTP packets that have been lost for this session (see {{bibref|RFC3611}}).

parameter.name: PacketsDiscarded
parameter.description: Total number of RTP packets that have been discarded for this session (see {{bibref|RFC3611}}).

parameter.name: BytesReceived
parameter.description: Total number of bytes received for this session.

parameter.name: BytesSent
parameter.description: Total number of bytes sent for this session.

parameter.name: ReceivePacketLossRate
parameter.description: Current receive packet loss rate in percent, calculated as defined in {{bibref|RFC3550|Section 6.4}}.

parameter.name: FarEndPacketLossRate
parameter.description: Current far end receive packet lost rate in percent, calculated as defined in {{bibref|RFC3550|Section 6.4}}.

parameter.name: ReceiveInterarrivalJitter
parameter.description: Current receive interarrival jitter in timestamp units. Calculated from J(i) as defined in {{bibref|RFC3550|Section 6.4}}. A value of -1 indicates no reliable value is available.

parameter.name: FarEndInterarrivalJitter
parameter.description: Current Interarrival jitter in timestamp units as reported from the far-end device via RTCP. Calculated from J(i) as defined in {{bibref|RFC3550|Section 6.4}}. A value of -1 indicates no reliable value is available.

parameter.name: AverageReceiveInterarrivalJitter
parameter.description: Average receive interarrival jitter in timestamp units since the beginning of the current call. Calculated as the average of the interarrival jitter values reported by the far-end. A value of -1 indicates no reliable value is available.

parameter.name: AverageFarEndInterarrivalJitter
parameter.description: Average far-end interarrival jitter in timestamp units since the beginning of the current call. Calculated as the average of the interarrival jitter values reported by the far-end. A value of -1 indicates no reliable value is available.

parameter.name: RoundTripDelay
parameter.description: Current round trip delay in {{units}} calculated as defined in {{bibref|RFC3550|Section 6.4}}. A value of -1 indicates no reliable value is available.

parameter.name: AverageRoundTripDelay
parameter.description: Average round trip delay in {{units}} since the beginning of the current session. A value of -1 indicates no reliable value is available.

parameter.name: SamplingFrequency
parameter.description: Sample frequency in {{units}} used by the codec for this session.

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.CallLog.{i}.Session.{i}.Destination.DSP.
object.description: The DSP part of the destination session information.

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.CallLog.{i}.Session.{i}.Destination.DSP.ReceiveCodec.
object.description: The receive codec used in this session.

parameter.name: Codec
parameter.description: The codec in use for the incoming voice stream. {{reference}}

parameter.name: SilenceSuppression
parameter.description: Whether or not silence suppression is in use for the incoming voice stream.

parameter.name: Overruns
parameter.description: Total number of times the receive jitter buffer has overrun for this session.

parameter.name: Underruns
parameter.description: Total number of times the receive jitter buffer has underrun for this session.

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.CallLog.{i}.Session.{i}.Destination.DSP.TransmitCodec.
object.description: The transmit codec used in this session.

parameter.name: Codec
parameter.description: The codec in use for the outgoing voice stream. {{reference}}

parameter.name: SilenceSuppression
parameter.description: Whether or not silence suppression is in use for the outgoing voice stream.

parameter.name: PacketizationPeriod
parameter.description: Current outgoing packetization period in {{units}}.

parameter.name: Overruns
parameter.description: Total number of times the transmit jitter buffer has overrun for this session.

parameter.name: Underruns
parameter.description: Total number of times the transmit jitter buffer has underrun for this session.

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.CallLog.{i}.Session.{i}.Destination.VoiceQuality.
object.description: VoIP Statistics for current session instance.

parameter.name: VoIPQualityIndicator
parameter.description: {{list|representing the VoIP quality calculated for consecutive intervals of the session}} The interval is specified by {{param|.VoIPProfile.{i}.QICalculationInterval}} and the quality model used is specified by {{param|.VoIPProfile.{i}.QIModelUsed}}. The statistics values in this list MUST be in time order, with the oldest one first and the most recent one last. For long sessions the number of values might exceed the limit given by {{param|.Capabilities.QualityIndicator.MaxQIValues}}. In that case, the CPE MUST remove the oldest values to keep the number of reported values within the limit. The interpretation of the QI values are algorithm-specific, the only constraints being the numeric range and the fact that lower values indicate worse quality than do higher values. For instance, if {{param}} is reported as "78,57,88,79,34,56", and {{param|.VoIPProfile.{i}.QICalculationInterval}} is 10 seconds, the quality during the first ten seconds was 78, the next ten seconds 57, and so on. The last reported value (here 56) might cover a shorter time period than {{param|.VoIPProfile.{i}.QICalculationInterval}}, but the length can be deduced using {{param|##.Duration}}.

parameter.name: WorstVoIPQualityIndicatorsValues
parameter.description: {{list|representing the worst VoIP quality indicators calculated during the whole session}} Only the N worst values are stored, where N is the limit stored in the {{param|.VoIPProfile.{i}.NumberOfWorstQIValues}} attribute. The values are given in the same algorithm-specific representation as {{param|VoIPQualityIndicator}}, and MUST be in quality-order with the lowest value first. Example: "34,56,57" are the 3 worst values calculated during the call.

parameter.name: WorstVoIPQualityIndicatorTimestamps
parameter.description: {{list}} Each value represents the timestamp index, given in units of {{param|.VoIPProfile.{i}.QICalculationInterval}}, when the corresponding value in {{param|WorstVoIPQualityIndicatorsValues}} was calculated. The first index is number 1. Only the N worst values are stored, where N is the limit stored in {{param|.VoIPProfile.{i}.NumberOfWorstQIValues}}. Example: if {{param|.VoIPProfile.{i}.QICalculationInterval}} is equal to 10 (seconds), the value "6,2,5" designates the time intervals 50-60 s, 10-20 s, and 40-50 s when the 3 worst values were calculated.

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.VoIPProfile.{i}.
object.description: Configuration profile that can be shared by VoIP components. A VoIP Profile contains media transport configuration parameters that are common to different VoIP protocols. VoIP Profiles could be used by {{object|.SIP.Network.}}, {{object|.SIP.Proxy.}}, {{object|.SIP.Network.}}, {{object|.H323.Network.}} and {{object|.MGCP.Network.}}.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this VoIP profile. If the value is set to {{false}}, all components using the profile are disabled, whatever their status is.

parameter.name: QuiescentMode
parameter.description: If {{true}}, when {{param|Enable}} is set to {{false}} in-progress sessions remain intact, but no new sessions are allowed. When all sessions are terminated, the {{object}} is disabled.

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: Human-readable string to identify the profile instance.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: DTMFMethod
parameter.description: {{list}} Method by which DTMF digits MUST be passed. {{enum}} If {{param|DTMFMethodG711}} is non-empty, then this parameter applies only when the current codec is not G.711.

enumeration.description: Applicable only for {{object|.SIP.Client.{i}.}}.

parameter.name: DTMFMethodG711
parameter.description: Method by which DTMF digits MUST be passed if the the current codec is G.711. {{enum}} If {{empty}} indicates that the value of {{param|DTMFMethod}} is to apply whether or not the the the current codec is G.711.

enumeration.description: Applicable only for {{object|.SIP.Client.{i}.}}.

parameter.name: QIModelUsed
parameter.description: Quality model which the CPE shall use to calculate the parameters {{param|.CallLog.{i}.Session.{i}.Source.VoiceQuality.VoIPQualityIndicator}} and {{param|.CallLog.{i}.Session.{i}.Destination.VoiceQuality.VoIPQualityIndicator}}. The value MUST be a member of the list reported by the {{param|.Capabilities.QualityIndicator.QIModelsSupported}} parameter.

parameter.name: QICalculationInterval
parameter.description: The interval between successive calculations of {{param|.CallLog.{i}.Session.{i}.Source.VoiceQuality.VoIPQualityIndicator}} and {{param|.CallLog.{i}.Session.{i}.Destination.VoiceQuality.VoIPQualityIndicator}} values (in {{units}}). If {{param}} is not set then only one final quality value covering the complete session is reported in {{param|.CallLog.{i}.Session.{i}.Source.VoiceQuality.VoIPQualityIndicator}} and {{param|.CallLog.{i}.Session.{i}.Destination.VoiceQuality.VoIPQualityIndicator}}.

parameter.name: NumberOfWorstQIValues
parameter.description: The maximum number of worst quality indicators to store for each call. The CPE MUST permit {{param}} to be set to any value in the range from 0 to {{param|.Capabilities.QualityIndicator.MaxWorstQIValues}}.

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.VoIPProfile.{i}.RTP.
object.description: VoIP profile parameters related to the voice stream sent via RTP.

parameter.name: LocalPortMin
parameter.description: Base of port range to be used for incoming RTP streams for this profile.

parameter.name: LocalPortMax
parameter.description: Top of port range to be used for incoming RTP streams for this profile.

parameter.name: Gmin
parameter.description: Minimum number of consecutive received packets after the end of an RTP Loss Event. A Loss Event is defined as as a sequence of lost or discarded packets, possibly including islands of received packets. Each island consists of up to ({{param}} - 1) received packets (a sequence of {{param}} received packets terminates the Loss Event, and so is not an island).

parameter.name: DSCPMark
parameter.description: Diffserv code point to be used for outgoing RTP and RTCP packets for this profile. It is RECOMMENDED that by default the DSCP for RTP traffic be set to the value to indicate EF traffic.

parameter.name: VLANIDMark
parameter.description: VLAN ID (as defined in {{bibref|802.1Q-2005}}) to be used for outgoing RTP packets for this profile. A value of -1 indicates the default value is to be used. If either {{param}} or {{param|EthernetPriorityMark}} is greater than zero, then the outgoing frames MUST be tagged. Otherwise, the outgoing frames MAY be tagged or untagged.

parameter.name: EthernetPriorityMark
parameter.description: Ethernet priority code (as defined in {{bibref|802.1D-2004}}) to be used for outgoing RTP packets for this profile. A value of -1 indicates the default value is to be used. If either {{param|VLANIDMark}} or {{param}} is greater than zero, then the outgoing frames MUST be tagged. Otherwise, the outgoing frames MAY be tagged or untagged.

parameter.name: TelephoneEventPayloadType
parameter.description: Payload type to be used for RTP telephone events. This parameter indicates the payload type to be used for DTMF events if transmission of DTMF information is in use according to {{bibref|RFC4733}}.

parameter.name: JitterBufferType
parameter.description: The indicates if the jitte buffer is static or dynamic.

parameter.name: JitterBufferMaxSize
parameter.description: Maximal (or static) jitter buffer size in {{units}}.

parameter.name: JitterBufferMinSize
parameter.description: Minimal jitter buffer size in {{units}}, not used if static buffer is used.

parameter.name: JitterBufferActualSize
parameter.description: Actual jitter buffer size in {{units}}, if static buffer ist used equal to {{param|JitterBufferMaxSize}}.

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.VoIPProfile.{i}.RTP.RTCP.
object.description: VoIP profile parameters related to RTCP.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enable or disable RTCP.

parameter.name: TxRepeatInterval
parameter.description: Transmission repeat interval, in {{units}}.

parameter.name: LocalCName
parameter.description: Local Cname (canonical name).

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.VoIPProfile.{i}.RTP.SRTP.
object.description: VoIP profile parameters for secure voice transmission via SRTP.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enable or disable the use of SRTP. If RTCP is enabled, a {{true}} value of this parameter also implies the use of SRTCP.

parameter.name: KeyingMethods
parameter.description: {{list|available keying methods}} {{enum}}

parameter.name: EncryptionKeySizes
parameter.description: {{list|available encryption key sizes}}

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.VoIPProfile.{i}.RTP.Redundancy.
object.description: VoIP profile parameters for RTP payload redundancy as defined by {{bibref|RFC2198}}.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enable or disable the use of RTP payload redundancy as defined by {{bibref|RFC2198}}.

parameter.name: PayloadType
parameter.description: The Payload Type of RTP packet as defined in {{bibref|RFC2198}}. Values SHOULD be within the range of dynamic Payload Types (96-127).

parameter.name: BlockPayloadType
parameter.description: Block Payload Type of redundancy packet.

parameter.name: FaxAndModemRedundancy
parameter.description: Specifies the redundancy number for fax and modem pass-through data transmissions. A non-negative value indicates that {{bibref|RFC2198}} is to be used for fax and modem pass-through data. The value indicates the number of redundant copies to be transmitted (the total number transmitted is one plus this value). A value of -1 indicates {{bibref|RFC2198}} is not to be used for fax and modem pass-through data. If {{param|ModemRedundancy}} is present, then {{param}} applies only to fax transmissions, but not to modem transmissions.

parameter.name: ModemRedundancy
parameter.description: Specifies the redundancy number for modem pass-through data transmissions. A non-negative value indicates that {{bibref|RFC2198}} is to be used for modem pass-through data. The value indicates the number of redundant copies to be transmitted (the total number transmitted is one plus this value). A value of -1 indicates {{bibref|RFC2198}} is not to be used for modem pass-through data.

parameter.name: DTMFRedundancy
parameter.description: Specifies the redundancy number for DTMF transmissions. A non-negative value indicates that {{bibref|RFC2198}} is to be used for DTMF. The value indicates the number of redundant copies to be transmitted (the total number transmitted is one plus this value). A value of -1 indicates {{bibref|RFC2198}} is not to be used for DTMF.

parameter.name: VoiceRedundancy
parameter.description: Specifies the redundancy number for general voice transmissions. A non-negative value indicates that {{bibref|RFC2198}} is to be used for voice. The value indicates the number of redundant copies to be transmitted (the total number transmitted is one plus this value). A value of -1 indicates {{bibref|RFC2198}} is not to be used for voice.

parameter.name: MaxSessionsUsingRedundancy
parameter.description: The maximum number of sessions using {{bibref|RFC2198}} payload redundancy simultaneously in this profile. A value of zero indicates no explicit limit on the number of sessions using redundancy.

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.VoIPProfile.{i}.FaxT38.
object.description: T.38 Fax information for devices that support T.38 relay.

parameter.name: MaxBitRate
parameter.description: Maximum data rate in {{units}} for fax as defined in {{bibref|T.38}}.

parameter.name: HighSpeedRedundancy
parameter.description: Specifies the packet-level redundancy for high-speed data transmissions (i.e., T.4 image data).

parameter.name: LowSpeedRedundancy
parameter.description: Specifies the packet-level redundancy for low-speed data transmissions (i.e., T.30 handshaking information).

parameter.name: TCFMethod
parameter.description: The method with which data is handled over the network.

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.CodecProfile.{i}.
object.description: Table of codec profiles. This table MUST be populated with the set of supported codecs matching {{object|.Capabilities.Codec.}}. Additional entries can be added to use different configurations of codec or to use the same codec configuration in different CodecList parameters.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enable or disable the use of this combination of codec parameters.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Codec
parameter.description: {{reference}}

parameter.name: PacketizationPeriod
parameter.description: {{list}} Each item is a supported packetization period, in milliseconds, or continuous ranges of packetization periods as defined in {{param|.Capabilities.Codec.{i}.PacketizationPeriod}}. The ACS MAY restrict the set of packetization periods by modifying the value of this parameter to a more restricted set of values than is listed in {{param|.Capabilities.Codec.{i}.PacketizationPeriod}}. The CPE MUST ignore any values or portions of ranges outside of those specified in {{param|.Capabilities.Codec.{i}.PacketizationPeriod}}.

parameter.name: SilenceSuppression
parameter.description: Indicates support for silence suppression for this codec. If silence suppression is supported, it can be disabled for this codec/bit-rate by setting this parameter to {{false}}.

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.Tone.
object.description: This object defines the contents of the tones and announcements generated locally by the VoIP device.

parameter.name: DescriptionNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: PatternNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: EventProfileNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: DefautEventProfile
parameter.description: Reference to the default tone event profile.

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.Tone.Description.{i}.
