object.description: Each entry in this table defines the contents of an individual tone. The defaults given for this object apply only to explicit creation of an instance of this object and not to automatic creation of instances of this object due to creation of a parent object.

parameter.name: ToneEnable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the tone entry. If a disabled tone entry is referenced, the result is that no tone is played.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: ToneName
parameter.description: Name of the tone.

parameter.name: TonePattern
parameter.description: This is the {{object|#.Pattern.{i}.}} object that begins this tone. If the tone is specified by a tone file instead of a tone pattern, this parameter MUST be set to {{empty}}. {{reference}}

parameter.name: ToneFile
parameter.description: The file name of a tone file locally present on the CPE. An ACS MUST use the Download method with FileType="4 Tone File" as defined in {{bibref|TR-069a4|Annex A.3.2.8}} to download a tone file. If the tone is specified by a tone pattern instead of a tone file, this parameter MUST be {{empty}}.

parameter.name: ToneRepetitions
parameter.description: The default number of times the data in {{param|ToneFile}} is repeated. If the value is 0 (zero) then {{param|ToneFile}} is played indefinitely.

parameter.name: ToneText
parameter.description: The text to be displayed by on the screen of the VoIP device when the tone is played and no specific error message has been provided. This parameter is applicable only for VoIP devices capable text display.

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.Tone.Pattern.{i}.
object.description: Each entry in the table defines a single phase in an overall tone pattern. Each phase identifies the entry that corresponds to the next phase. Each entry in the table refers to the entry that corresponds to the next phase of the pattern. The table MAY be set up such that entries form loops, or MAY end after a finite sequence. The defaults given for this object apply only to explicit creation of an instance of this object and not to automatic creation of instances of this object due to creation of a parent object.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this entry.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: ToneOn
parameter.description: Whether or not a tone is on during this phase of the pattern. If the value is {{false}}, the frequency and power parameters in this entry MUST be ignored.

parameter.name: Frequency1
parameter.description: First tone frequency in {{units}}. A value of zero indicates this tone component is not used.

parameter.name: Power1
parameter.description: First tone power level in units of 0.1 {{units}}.

parameter.name: Frequency2
parameter.description: Second tone frequency in {{units}}. A value of zero indicates this tone component is not used.

parameter.name: Power2
parameter.description: Second tone power level in units of 0.1 {{units}}.

parameter.name: Frequency3
parameter.description: Third tone frequency in {{units}}. A value of zero indicates this tone component is not used.

parameter.name: Power3
parameter.description: Third tone power level in units of 0.1 {{units}}.

parameter.name: Frequency4
parameter.description: Fourth tone frequency in {{units}}. A value of zero indicates this tone component is not used.

parameter.name: Power4
parameter.description: Fourth tone power level in units of 0.1 {{units}}.

parameter.name: ModulationFrequency
parameter.description: Modulation frequency in {{units}}. A value of zero indicates this tone component is not used.

parameter.name: ModulationPower
parameter.description: Modulation power level in units of 0.1 {{units}}.

parameter.name: Duration
parameter.description: The duration of this phase of the tone pattern, in {{units}}. A value of zero indicates an unlimited duration.

parameter.name: NextPattern

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.Tone.EventProfile.{i}.
object.description: Configuration profile for tone events.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: EventNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.Tone.EventProfile.{i}.Event.{i}.
object.description: Table of events for which a tone is defined. The table is pre-populated with the list of events for which the CPE supports definition of tones.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Function
parameter.description: The event for which the tone is to apply. {{enum}} The parameter MAY instead indicate a vendor-specific event name, which MUST use the format defined in {{bibref|TR-106}}.

parameter.name: Tone

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.Terminal.{i}.
object.description: This object models a telephony terminal, each object in the table represents an end-user interface. This object has to be used when the CPE is a voice endpoint itself.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this terminal.

parameter.name: QuiescentMode
parameter.description: If {{true}}, when {{param|Enable}} is set to {{false}} in-progress sessions remain intact, but no new sessions are allowed. When all sessions are terminated, the {{object}} is disabled.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Indicates the status of this terminal.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: ToneEventProfile
parameter.description: Reference to the {{object|.Tone.EventProfile}} to use with this terminal. If this parameter is {{empty}}, the value of {{param|.Tone.DefautEventProfile}} is used instead.

parameter.name: AudioNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.Terminal.{i}.Audio.{i}.
object.description: This object models the audio outputs of a telephony terminal.(ex. Handset, handsfree, ...)

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: The internal name of this audio.

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.Terminal.{i}.Audio.{i}.VoiceProcessing.
object.description: Parameters related to voice processing capabilities.

parameter.name: TransmitGain
parameter.description: Gain in {{units}} to apply to the transmitted voice signal prior to encoding. This gain is a modifier of the default transmit-gain, which is unspecified.

parameter.name: ReceiveGain
parameter.description: Gain in {{units}} to apply to the received voice signal after decoding. This gain is a modifier of the default receive-gain, which is unspecified.

parameter.name: EchoCancellationEnable
parameter.description: Enable or disable echo cancellation for this line.

parameter.name: EchoCancellationInUse
parameter.description: Indication of whether or not echo cancellation is currently in use for this line.

parameter.name: EchoCancellationTail
parameter.description: Tail length in {{units}} of the echo canceller associated with this line (whether or not it is currently in use).

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.Terminal.{i}.ButtonMap.
object.description: This object is provided to permit the purpose of the CPE buttons and function keys to be defined via the ACS. Support of this object is appropriate only for a device that has programmable buttons in its user interface.

parameter.name: ButtonNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.Terminal.{i}.ButtonMap.Button.{i}.
object.description: Each entry in this table specifies the purpose of each programmable CPE button / function key and whether the user has permission to reprogram the button.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: ButtonName
parameter.description: Name of the button.

parameter.name: FacilityAction
parameter.description: The value MUST be a member of the list reported by {{param|.Capabilities.FacilityActions}}. This is an OPTIONAL parameter that SHOULD NOT be specified for buttons not related to a particular Facility Action (e.g., invocation of ''Call Return'') implemented by the VoIP device. The parameter MAY instead indicate a vendor-specific Facility Action, which MUST use the format defined in {{bibref|TR-106}}. An empty or unrecognized string (i.e. a Facility Action not supported by the CPE) means that there is no Facility Action to be taken. If this parameter is specified (not {{empty}}) then {{param|QuickDialNumber}} SHOULD be {{empty}}.

parameter.name: FacilityActionArgument
parameter.description: Optional argument associated with the specified {{param|FacilityAction}}. The interpretation of the argument is dependent on the specific FacilityAction.

parameter.name: QuickDialNumber
parameter.description: This is a string representing a quick dial destination number. Only the characters '0-9', '*' and '#' can be used. If this parameter is specified (not {{empty}}) then {{param|FacilityAction}} SHOULD be {{empty}}.

parameter.name: ButtonMessage
parameter.description: This string represents the message to be displayed on the screen when the button or function key is pressed.

parameter.name: UserAccess
parameter.description: This parameter indicates whether the user has permission to program the button or function key. If this parameter is set to {{true}} then {{param|FacilityAction}}, {{param|QuickDialNumber}} and {{param|ButtonMessage}} MUST all be {{empty}}.

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.Terminal.{i}.Ringer.
object.description: This object defines the ring sequences that may be generated by the terminal.

parameter.name: DescriptionNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: PatternNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.Terminal.{i}.Ringer.Description.{i}.
object.description: Each entry in this table defines the contents of an individual ring specification. The defaults given for this object apply only to explicit creation of an instance of this object and not to automatic creation of instances of this object due to creation of a parent object.

parameter.name: RingEnable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the ring description entry. If a disabled ring description entry is referenced, the result is that no ring is played.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: RingName
parameter.description: Name of the ring.

parameter.name: RingPattern
parameter.description: This is the {{object|#.Pattern.{i}.}} object that begins this ring. If the ring is specified by a ring file instead of a ring pattern, this parameter MUST be set to {{empty}}. {{reference}}

parameter.name: RingFile
parameter.description: The file name of a ring file file locally present on the CPE. An ACS MUST use the Download method with FileType="5 Ringer File" as defined in {{bibref|TR-069a4|Annex A.3.2.8}} to download a ring file. If the ring is specified by a ring pattern instead of a ring file, this parameter MUST be {{empty}}.

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.Terminal.{i}.Ringer.Pattern.{i}.
object.description: Each entry in the table defines a single phase in an overall ring pattern. Each phase identifies the entry that corresponds to the next phase. Each entry in the table refers to the entry that corresponds to the next phase of the pattern. The table MAY be set up such that entries form loops, or MAY end after a finite sequence. The defaults given for this object apply only to explicit creation of an instance of this object and not to automatic creation of instances of this object due to creation of a parent object.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this entry.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: RingerOn
parameter.description: Whether or not a ringer is on during this phase of the pattern.

parameter.name: Duration
parameter.description: The duration of this phase of the ring pattern, in {{units}}. A value of zero indicates an unlimited duration.

parameter.name: NextPattern

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.ClockSynchronization.
object.description: Clock source configuration for Time-Division multiplexing subsystem.

parameter.name: ClockSourceNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: CurrentSource
parameter.description: The currently selected external clock source. If the current clock source is not selected from the {{object|ClockSource}} table, e.g. an internal holdover clock, this parameter is set to {{empty}}. {{reference}}

parameter.name: Description
parameter.description: Human readable description of the current clock synchronization status.

parameter.name: AutoRevert
parameter.description: If set to {{true}} the CPE automatically reverts back to a higher priority external clock source when it becomes available once again. If set to {{false}}, an automatic change between external clock sources only occurs when the current source becomes unavailable.

object.name: VoiceService.{i}.ClockSynchronization.ClockSource.{i}.
object.description: List of eligible external clock sources. The number of entries in this table depends on the maximum number of external clock sources supported by the CPE.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this entry.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Order
parameter.description: Position of the {{object}} entry in the order of precedence. A value of "1" indicates the first entry considered (highest precedence).

parameter.name: Interface
parameter.description: A reference to a physical interface from which a clock signal can be derived. {{object|.ISDN.PRI.{i}.}} is eligible as a clock source when {{param|.ISDN.PRI.{i}.ClockMode}} is {{enum|Slave|.ISDN.PRI.{i}.ClockMode}}. {{object|.ISDN.BRI.{i}.}} is eligible as a clock source when {{param|.ISDN.BRI.{i}.ProtocolEmulation}} is {{enum|TE|.ISDN.BRI.{i}.ProtocolEmulation}}. {{reference}}
